title: Cardol.io: Portfolio Tracker
description: Cardano ecosystem is exploding outward & upward. It's increasingly difficult to easily & effectively track your assets across new projects

f6_assessments.q0: the proposal centralizes features that can already be viewed via other wallets and websites. it would make sense in an app, as it is currently not possible to bundle all the features mentioned in an app on a cell phone. the idea behind the project does not provide any significant added value for the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: the team members should provide a linked.in link and describe the experience so far in more detail. the timeline is understandable and most likely feasible. the required funds should also be broken down in the timeline for better understanding. the optics of the portfolios do not meet today's standards
f6_assessments.q2: risks within the project are not mentioned in detail. it is expected that the project can be implemented. the token should be explained in more detail. the usecase makes sense, but it is not clear to what extent the community will be the owner of it.

f6_assessments.q0:
I believe a dashboard like central place to see all cardano relevant information would be great. Maybe you could add in your examples also things like:
- beeing able to see not only in $ but e.g. also in € or BTC.
- seeing next voting rounds
- seeing the marketvalue and other infos on ALL cardano native tokens 
(etc - just a few ideas)
f6_assessments.q1: looks feasable to me, however what is not clear is how you plan to finance the long term survivability of this projeect - how do you ensure your project can be maintained and even extended for the furture? you can not rely on catalyst funding for ever
f6_assessments.q2: i believe the project developement can be tracked and audited.

f6_assessments.q0: All Cardano users will benefit from this app, which will run on top of Cardano's infrastructure and provides real value and a non existent solution to a problem.
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap is clear, well structured and the timelines look realistic for a team of 2. The budget is sensible, perhaps a bit low considering two devs will work over a year until project completion - but I understand there will be a token released which could fund the project as well as a stake pool in place. All in all, I believe this project can be implemented successfully with careful budgeting.
f6_assessments.q2:
It would have been good to add whether another participation in the fund will be required at a later date, in case the pool doesn't work or if funds are depleted sooner than expected.
It would have been good to showcase previous work done or projects achieved to be able to give more confidence in the building of the app.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal addresses a future real need for the ADA ecosystem user.
A tool like this is needed
f6_assessments.q1:
Technical experience in line with the goal of the project.
One of the proposer also run a staking pool.
I would encourage also the presence of a "marketing" side within the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The schedule is defined and tight.
The targets seem reasonable

f6_assessments.q0:
Yes the team copes well with the challenge.
Describes the solution to the problem with an Ada Portfolio that can engage people in the cardano ecosystem
f6_assessments.q1: The team consists of two people: a full stack developer and a data engineer. I think there's a good chance that the project will be successful because they know what they're talking about.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a fairly detailed roadmap and cost breakdown.
I would have liked to have had more information about the technologies involved in the development (the team only mentions AWS which is used for the infrastructure)

f6_assessments.q0: Meets the challenge but also looks to overlap with other projects. This isn't necessarily a bad thing as different teams will pivot as needed and each may not deliver as intended. Each time has a different vision which should be given space.
f6_assessments.q1: Team members look to be suitable, and development timeline is not crazy.
f6_assessments.q2: Milestones are clearly dated by quarter, which is not detailed enough for close auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: Portfolio Tracker is extremely needed, especially when investors are ramping up their Crypto Investing - with regards to DeFi. The need for tracking assets on Cardano has never been greater and this proposal properly addresses the challenge. It should be implemented as soon as possible.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer has relevant and sufficient knowledge to execute the proposal, but it will take a larger team with knowledge of blockchain and Cardano smart contracts to have this project implemented successfully in a timely manner.
f6_assessments.q2: The key performance indicators (KPIs) are well thought-out, and the timeline is reasonable. The ability to audit this proposal needs clearer metrics that can be easily viewed to determine if the proposal is successful.

f6_assessments.q0:
A dashboard is always welcomed, but how many people do put into the effort to invest in a lot of Cardno projects that they require a specific Cardano dashboard to track?

The proposal also included running a staking pool, stake pool ranking etc. It is unclear if this dashboard will be a wallet with a dashboard or purely dashboard.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is an ambitious proposal with lots of components. A dashboard that is able to display all your Cardano assets on one screen. 

A dashboard sounds easy to make in other places since established companies will have APIs ready for creators to simply plug it in. But in Cardano space where most things are still in early stages, info sharing API isn't on top of the list for development. Now this will be down to the proposer to create. 

In a year's time there will be more wallets coming out and features of current wallets will have grown. The proposal have not factored in the growing challenge it will face.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal outlines in Phase 1 Q3 2021, which is nearly coming to an end, but only 50% of it is auditable. The future phases carries on to a year later, $20k doesn't seem to be enough for this scale of development. 

A Beta Portfolio page still has a significant amount of information that needs displaying. Unsure if 3 months is enough for the APIs to be created.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies a problem faced by Cardano users and suggests a reasonable solution to save their time.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan is well written and the proposers seem to have lots of relevant experience, but there is no evidence of their claimed experience. Providing a link to Github or a social media page would add credibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The definition of success is clear and the roadmap is concise. Adding an analysis of potential risks to the project would improve the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is forward thinking in terms of planning ways to track and consolidate for the user the many sprawling arms of Cardano as the ecosystem grows. With the launch of smart contracts, the different applications, coins, NFTs on Cardano is likely to accelerate and this is a smart application to keep track of it all.
f6_assessments.q1: They clearly have a technically capable team that has thought about the utility and implementation of this project. They've sketched out understandable wireframes to demo what the product can become, and they're leveraging other available funding (AWS credits) to help execute on the vision.
f6_assessments.q2: They have laid out a clear timeline for implementation of the project, step-by-step, that seems realistic and not too aggressive.

f6_assessments.q0: With an increasing number of assets on the Cardano blockchain it is fundamental to manage them in a unique space. This DApp woul effectively allow not only the management of multiple tokens, but also multiple addresses
f6_assessments.q1: One of the two proposers previously run a staking pool, o creating a dedicated staking pool to support the project is not going to be an issue. Also their IT experience seems to be more than sufficient to run the project. However, there could be a lack of marketing to let the people know about the existence of the tool
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap and the success criteria are sufficiently expanded. Plus, the budget required seems adequate to cover the development cost. It's not clear how the token OLIO will be distributed.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal directly addresses the challenge of tracking native assets as the cardano ecosystem scales and welcomes users  in the future. The NFT space in particular has a lot gaps on current chains like Ethereum. With the high gas fees and unuseability particularly for retail investors, they are likely to seek cheaper alternatives for purchases. There is also a lack of visibility on metamsk for value and it is necessary to check open sea to track asset value. Having a platform which consolidates all assests including NFT, token and even Defi value is crucial and may entice current and new users in the space.
f6_assessments.q1: Considering the proposers prior and current engagement within the Cardano ecosystem it seems highly probable that this proposal will be initiated if selected and voted on. The proposers provide a sound road map and detailed breakdown of allocated fund usage.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers provide a detailed roadmap for their initiative which is a crucial part of why cardano has been successful as it keeps the community informed. THis also allows the developers to be accountable regarding their timelines.

f6_assessments.q0:
Tracking the portfolio is a time-consuming and tedious work for any investor. This proposal is very important at this stage to provide the investor with a transparent view of his investments from the very beginning. Especially beginners, who are overwhelmed by the possibilities, get a possibility to track the success of their investments and to make possible optimizations. For investors with experience in other ecosystems, this can be a reason to switch to the Cardano ecosystem.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind this proposal has vast experience in all areas required to successfully implement this project. The defined goals are achievable. The question is whether the start of a stakepool can be pushed back to bring the MVP to market faster.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria are primarily based on quantitative values of users and stakers. These criteria seem achievable. For the voter, a more granular listing of which features are available at what time would be helpful. For example, when will the staking performance display be available.

f6_assessments.q0: Very good idea and much needed for users to have the best control over their investments with an easy to use friendly interface.
f6_assessments.q1: The images are very intuitive, the budget and the time line are clear. The part of the plan I understand is that you guys will continue to develop, need to add more clarity on the use of tokens
f6_assessments.q2: Solution description easy to understand, clear step-by-step route

solution: Build a consolidated dashboard to track ADA portfolio, native tokens & NFTs across various dapps & projects that a user has integrated with
experience: RH: software engineer, previously ran Cardano stakepool & currently in EMURGO Cardano dev program. MB: information designer & data engineer
